attributes.title: Hasbro: The Dip Is An Opportunity
summary: Hasbro is down 10% over the past three months.
This dip is an opportunity to buy Hasbro as the outlook of the company is intact.
Hasbro rewarded well its shareholders as the company returned $241 million through dividend and share repurchase program.

attributes.content:
The U.S. toy industry is hot this year, and most the toymakers are set to end the ongoing fiscal year on a high note backed by a nice holiday season. Star Wars: The Force Awakens, which is the most awaited movie of this year, is the growth driving force for toy industry this year and perhaps the next year too. Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS), the second-largest toymaker, is one of the beneficiaries of licensed toys, and recently, the company beat the consensus estimated for its third quarter earnings.

Hasbro ended the third quarter 2015 with earnings per share of $1.64, up 15% over the same period last year, while consensus had estimated $1.51 in earnings per share. Flat sales revenue, on the other hand, missed the estimate and stock price collapsed amid concerns over top-line growth. After losing 10% value over the past three months, Hasbro is trading at an attractive level to execute a buy as the long-term outlook of the company is intact.

Top-line Is Not That Bad

Hasbro recorded net sales revenue of $1.47 billion for the most recent quarter, almost flat. Despite that, the overall performance of Hasbro remained satisfactory as the negative impact of a strong dollar was offsetting the top-line growth throughout the quarter. Meanwhile, sales rose 9% excluding the adverse currency impact of $132.4 million. Hasbro showed impressive strengthen across its product portfolio with boys and preschool categories posting double-digit growth. However, Hasbro lagged again in girls' category and games sales also failed to add growth. Overall, net earnings for the third quarter 2015 increased to $207.6 million, up from $180.5 million in the same period last year, a jump of around 15%. Going forward, with the ease in currency headwind, the top-line of the company is expected to show further strengthen in the short as well as long-term, primarily due to Hasbro's portfolio of popular licensed toys.
